definition: Kai-Fu Lee (1961-), Taiwanese computer scientist and IT executive, founding president of Google China 2005-2009

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: Young Chinese follow Kaifu Lee`s every move.
sentences.chinese: 李开复，中国的年轻人对其一举一动都趋之若鹜。

sentences.english: Former VP of Google, Kai-Fu Lee is an icon of success in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，前谷歌副总裁，李开复，是成功的典范。

sentences.english: In 2005, the prosecution of Microsoft on Google hired away Kai-fu Lee.
sentences.chinese: 2005年，微软就起诉谷歌挖走了李开复。

sentences.english: Lee was perhaps the most famous of all sea turtles.
sentences.chinese: 李开复或许是所有海龟中最知名的一位。

sentences.english: The company successfully poached Microsoft Vice President Kai-Fu Lee to run its Chinese business.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌成功地将微软副总裁李开复挖过来负责中国业务。

sentences.english: At first, when Kai-Fu Lee was incharge of Google China, it worked fine. Google China could follow the cadence.
sentences.chinese: 一开始李开复在谷歌中国的时候，还算正常。

sentences.english: When she was called to Kai-Fu Lee's office for dismissal, she was dumbfounded.
sentences.chinese: 当李开复叫她到办公室说开除一事，她目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: Dr. Lee’s decision — and his timing — provided instant fuel for China’s entrepreneurial fire.
sentences.chinese: 李开复的决定和规划燎燃了中国大地上的创业之火。

sentences.english: The trouble is there’s a dearth of angel capital and early stage coaching, Lee says.
sentences.chinese: 李开复认为问题在于中国缺乏天使投资和早期指导。

definition: Robin Li (1968-), founder and CEO of Baidu 百度, a PRC Internet company
Ma Huateng aka Pony Ma (1971-), Chinese business magnate, CEO of Tencent
Mark Zuckerberg (1984-), American computer programer, co-founder and CEO of Facebook
SenseTime, artificial intelligence company focused on computer vision and deep learning technologies, founded in Hong Kong in 2014

pinyin: ji4 suan4 ji1 ke1 xue2 jia1

definition: Baidu, Internet portal and search engine, www.baidu.com, listed as BIDU on NASDAQ since 1999
Ding Lei (1971-), founder and CEO of NetEase 網易|网易[Wang3 yi4]
Elon Musk (1971-), founder and CEO of SpaceX, co-founder and CEO of Tesla Motors
